chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cathy R Littlebird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain her HSED or GED, or it's equivalent.  Obtain and maintain employment commensurate with her treatment needs.  Not to terminate employment without her agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by her agent.
Undergo a mental health evaluation, if her agent recommends.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

No contact with any known active illegal drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Obtain a valid driver's  license if she is eligible.  

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is entered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Bosben.  Parties have the revocation summary.  Corrections noted.  Sentence credit discussed.  Judge Pasell questioned the defendant if she wanted to proceed with him or reset with Judge Becker.  She wants to proceed with Judge Pasell.  State recommended:  In 16CF90- Count 1, 1 year Co. jail.  Concurrent.  Count 4- 1 year jail.  Concurrent.  15CF81- 30 days,  on count 1.  9 months jail on count 2.  Concurrent.  15CF38.  1 year Co. jail.  Concurrent.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  Joint recommendation.  

Court ordered:   In 16CF90- Count 1, 1 year Co. jail.  Concurrent.  Count 4- 6 months jail.  Concurrent.  15CF81- 30 days,  on count 1.   BJ 6 months jail on count 2.  Concurrent.  15CF38.  1 year Co. jail.  Concurrent.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.   Credit for 119 days on 16CF90, 15CF38.  119 days credit on 15CF81.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  EMP allowed according to jail rules only if involved in a treatment program.
sent ROAW to Judge Becker today.  JMM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 28, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Bosben.  Found guilty of Count 1.  Joint recommendation for 4 years probation.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Obtain and maintain employment.  60 days stayed on condition she completes AODA.  No contact with known active drug users and dealers.  Mental health evaluation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 4 years probation, concurrent.   AODA and recommended treatment.  Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with her treatment needs.   Not to terminate without her agent's prior approval.  No contact with any known active drug users and dealers.  Undergo a mental health evaluation if agent recommends.  Obtain HSED.  Obtain a valid driver's license if she is eligible.   Subject to random drug testing.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC  DNA sample and surcharge.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Bosben.  Parties stipulate that Count 1 diversion agreement be revoked.  Court ordered the diversion agreement revoked.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
to revoke deferred prosecution agreement.
MH to revoke DPA scheduled at request of ADA Inlow.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Diversion agreement filed in 15CF38 for count 1. Defendant plead guilty to that count.  Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Amended information filed in 15CF81.  Amends Count 2 to misdemeanor bail jumping.  Plead guilty to counts 1 and 2 in 15CF81.  15CT45 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court questioned the defendant on her understanding of the diversion agreement.  She stated she understood the agreement and can comply with the conditions.  Felony warnings given.  She also understood those warnings.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered her pleas and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty as plead to in 15CF81.  Finding withheld on Count 1 of 15CF38.  Court approved the diversion agreement.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Case resolved.  Set for plea/sentencing with JA.
